GOVERNMENT OF INDIA 
BUREAU OF CIVIL AVIATION SECURITY 
(MINISTRY OF CIVIL AVIATION) 
A’ WING JANPATH BHAWAN 
JANPATH, NEW DELHI 
 
Dated :       20 /10/2010 
 
 
 
AVSEC ORDER NO. 06 /2010 
 
 
 
Subject :   Procedure / Norms for conducting the survey / re-survey of   
                 ASG / CISF manpower for deployment at Airports in India. 
 
 
 
Commissioner of Security (Civil Aviation), Bureau of Civil Aviation Security, in 
exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of Aircraft Act 1934 delegated to him 
vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification No. 1797 dated July 
3, 1997 for the purpose of securing the safety of aircraft operation directs that :- 
 
Where less than 100 ASG personnel are required for deployment at any 
airport, the existing procedure will be followed up; and where 100 or more ASG 
personnel are required, Addl. Commissioner of Security(CA), BCAS will lead the 
following team to conduct the survey / re-survey of ASG/CISF manpower for 
deployment at airports in India :- 
 
i. 
Representative of Ministry of Civil Aviation;  
ii. 
Representative of CISF from CISF HQrs; 
iii. 
Concerned Regional DCOS(CA), BCAS; 
iv. 
Representative of Airport Authority of India; and 
v. 
In case of Pvt. / JV Airport, a representative from Airport Operator 
should also assist the survey / re-survey team ( i.e not participating 
in the survey/ re-survey ) 
 
 
This order will come into force with immediate effect.  
 
 
 
 
 
 ( Gurjot Singh Malhi,  IPS )  
 Commissioner of Security (CA) 
Distribution as per list attached.
